title: Rational design of small-molecule immune checkpoints' inhibitors
authors: Khaled Barakat. University of Alberta, Edmonton, AB, Canada
text: Blocking the PD-1/PD-L1 and CTLA-4 pathways recently emerged as a ‘game changer’ in cancer immunotherapy, leading to the selection of monoclonal-antibodies (MABs) targeting PD-1 as ‘drug of the year’ for 2013. Although these antibodies restored exhausted T cells’ function to recognize and kill tumor cells, these MABs have numerous disadvantages. These include their very high cost and very severe side effects. Our team has been focused on designing small molecule inhibitors for this pathway. Compared to available MAB therapies, our small molecules may offer a more affordable, more easily administered and better controlled treatment for a variety of cancers. Here, we demonstrate our efforts toward this goal and summarize our data on our promising compounds targeting the PD-1/PD-L1 and CTLA-4 pathways.
